Hi all we are observing a strange behvaiour where rbac/v1 apis are getting available only after ~5-6 mins on api-server start up, had raised an issue <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/56899> is anyone else also seeing this? hi all and <@U0CBHE6GM> , i wanted to let you know that the sig-windows would like to update feature <https://github.com/kubernetes/features/issues/116> to alpha for v1.5 of k8s instead of beta. We have been plagued by a myriad of issues around automated e2e tests (with the support of sig-testing) and DNS issues coming from the Docker implementation on windows. Alpha would more closely represent reality given some of the gaps outlined above. is that ok?

Hi! I recently tried making my first update to the k8s docs here: <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes.github.io/pull/1752>  I'm just trying to find out if there is anything else I need to do.

We're facing an issue with authorization mode "allow all" and some manifests that uses RBAC resources.

As far as we understood, the RBAC API is enabled by default but not the RBAC authorizer (<https://github.com/kubernetes/features/issues/2#issuecomment-330569468>).

So a manifest using RBAC resources should works (RBAC API would create unused stuff as there is not the RBAC authorizer to use them).

But we get a message "<http://clusterroles.rbac.authorization.k8s.io|clusterroles.rbac.authorization.k8s.io> "xxx" is forbidden: attempt to grant extra privileges" like there is an authorizer doing its authorization job (but we're yet using the flag `--authorization-mode=AlwaysAllow`).

Does one have an idea about it ? do we miss something ? or is that some kind of bug with authz system ?
